summary: Frontend testing for skeleton loaders, footer links, and login page data-testid attributes. Skeleton loaders are displaying but route-specific differentiation may be too fast to observe. Footer links present but routes may have routing issues. Critical issue: data-testid attributes NOT rendering in DOM.

integration_issues.issue: data-testid attributes defined in code (login-email-input, login-password-input, login-submit-button) are NOT rendering in DOM. This is because React Native uses 'testID' prop, not 'data-testid' HTML attribute. Need to change from data-testid='...' to testID='...' for React Native Web compatibility.
Saved Items link in footer navigates to /saved instead of /profile/saved as defined in QUICK_LINKS. This is likely due to expo-router tab routing behavior.
Messages link in footer navigates to /chat instead of /messages as defined in QUICK_LINKS. This is likely due to expo-router tab routing behavior.

action_items: CRITICAL: Change login.tsx to use 'testID' prop instead of 'data-testid' for React Native Web compatibility. Replace: data-testid='login-email-input' with testID='login-email-input' on lines 497, 512, 528, 665, 684, 704
Verify Footer.tsx QUICK_LINKS routes are correct (/profile/saved and /messages) and expo-router is routing properly
Consider if page-specific skeletons are distinguishable enough during font loading - fonts load very quickly making skeleton differentiation hard to observe
critical_code_review_comments: login.tsx lines 497, 512, 528: Using data-testid HTML attribute instead of React Native's testID prop - this doesn't render to DOM in React Native Web
Skeleton loader implementation in _layout.tsx is correct - uses usePathname() to determine route and renders appropriate skeleton
Footer.tsx QUICK_LINKS array correctly defines Saved Items -> /profile/saved and Messages -> /messages routes
context_for_next_testing_agent: data-testid attributes not working due to React Native Web limitation. Need to use testID prop. Skeleton loaders show but are generic HomepageSkeleton pattern. Footer link navigation might be affected by expo-router tab navigation logic.

skeleton_loaders.note: All pages show same skeleton - either route differentiation happens too fast or there's an issue with route detection during font loading

login_page_data_testid.root_cause: React Native uses testID prop, not data-testid HTML attribute
